fusionlibrary.train_functionsïƒ

Contains the train_and_test function: trains and tests a model and, if k_fold trained, a fold.

Functions

store_trained_model(trained_model,Â ...)

Stores the trained model to a dictionary. If model type is already in dictionary (e.g. if it's a kfold model), append the model to the list of models.

train_and_save_models(trained_models_dict,Â ...)

Trains/tests the model and saves the trained model to a dictionary for further analysis.

fusionlibrary.train_functions.train_and_save_models(trained_models_dict, data_module, params, fusion_model, init_model, extra_log_string_dict=None, layer_mods=None)[source]ïƒ

Trains/tests the model and saves the trained model to a dictionary for further analysis. If the training type is kfold, it will train and test the model for each fold and store the trained models in a list under the model type key.

Parameters:

  • trained_models_dicts (dict) â€“ Dictionary of trained models.

  • data_module (pytorch lightning data module) â€“ Data module.

  • params (dict) â€“ Dictionary of parameters.

  • fusion_model (class) â€“ Fusion model class.

  • init_model (class) â€“ Init model class (initialized empty for method details).

  • extra_log_string_dict (dict) â€“

    Dictionary of extra log strings. Extra string to add to the run name during logging.

    e.g. if youâ€™re running the same model with different hyperparameters, you can add the hyperparameters. Input format {â€œnameâ€: â€œvalueâ€}. In the run name, the extra string will be added as â€œname_valueâ€. And a tag will be added as â€œname_valueâ€.

  • layer_mods (dict) â€“ Dictionary of layer modifications. Used to modify the architecture of the model. Input format {â€œmodelâ€: {â€œlayer_groupâ€: â€œmodificationâ€}, â€¦}. e.g. {â€œTabularCrossmodalAttentionâ€: {â€œmod1_layersâ€: new mod 1 layers nn.ModuleDict}} Default None.

fusionlibrary.train_functions.train_and_test(dm, params, k, fusion_model, init_model, extra_log_string_dict=None, layer_mods=None)[source]ïƒ

Trains and tests a model and, if k_fold trained, a fold.

Parameters:

  • dm (pytorch lightning data module) â€“ Data module.

  • params (dict) â€“ Dictionary of parameters.

  • k (int) â€“ Fold number.

  • fusion_model (class) â€“ Fusion model class.

  • init_model (class) â€“ Init model class (initialized empty for method details).

  • metric_name_list (list) â€“ List of metric names.

  • method_name (str) â€“ Name of the method.

  • extra_log_string_dict (dict) â€“

    Dictionary of extra log strings. Extra string to add to the run name during logging.

    e.g. if youâ€™re running the same model with different hyperparameters, you can add the hyperparameters. Input format {â€œnameâ€: â€œvalueâ€}. In the run name, the extra string will be added as â€œname_valueâ€. And a tag will be added as â€œname_valueâ€.

  • layer_mods (dict) â€“ Dictionary of layer modifications. Used to modify the architecture of the model. Input format {â€œmodelâ€: {â€œlayer_groupâ€: â€œmodificationâ€}, â€¦}. e.g. {â€œTabularCrossmodalAttentionâ€: {â€œmod1_layersâ€: new mod 1 layers nn.ModuleDict}} Default None.

Returns:

  • model (pytorch lightning model) â€“ Trained model.

  • trainer (pytorch lightning trainer) â€“ Trained trainer.

  • metric_1 (float) â€“ Metric 1 (depends on metric_name_list and params[â€œpred_typeâ€]).

  • metric_2 (float) â€“ Metric 2 (depends on metric_name_list and params[â€œpred_typeâ€]).

  • val_reals (list) â€“ List of validation real values.

  • val_preds (list) â€“ List of validation predicted values.
